literature.title: A pragmatic randomized controlled trial of thiopurine methyltransferase genotyping prior to azathioprine treatment: the TARGET study.

markdown.html:
Main Findings

There was no significant difference in likelihood of discontinuing azathioprine due to an adverse reaction in the first 4 months of therapy when comparing patients who were dosed based on TPMT genotype and those who received a standard dose (p=0.74)

Dosing Protocol

Pharmacogenetic arm (n=167)
GenotypeNumberDosing Advice
TPMT wild-typen=148Maintenance dose of 1.5 - 3 mg/kg/day
TPMT *1/*2, *1/*3A, or *1/*3Cn=19Start at 25-50 mg/day and titrate to maintenance dose
TPMT homozygoten=0Do not start azathioprine, use alternative treatment
Standard dosing arm (n=166)
GenotypeNumber
TPMT wild-typen=150
TPMT *1/*2, *1/*3A, or *1/*3Cn=15
TPMT homozygoten=1

Additional Findings

The single individual in the study who was homozygous for unspecified TPMT variant/s was in the standard dosing arm and experienced severe nonfatal neutropenia. In the genotyping arm, the average starting dose of azathioprine was lower in heterozygotes than wild-type (p=0.007).

Additional Information

  • Ethnicity: England
  • Indication: Inflammatory disease

dosingInfo.text:
||There was NO significant difference in likelihood of stopping azathioprine due to an adverse reaction when comparing patients who were dosed based on TPMT genotype and those who received a standard dose (p=0.59)||

||Pharmacogenetic arm (n=167) - dosing advice for clinicians||
|TPMT wild-type| n=148 |Maintenance dose of 1.5 - 3 mg/kg/day|
|TPMT *1/*2, *1/*3A, or *1/*3C| n=19 |Start at 25-50 mg/day and titrate to maintenance dose|
|TPMT homozygote| n=0 |Do not start azathioprine, use alternative treatment|

||Standard dosing arm (n=166)||
|TPMT wild-type| n=150 |
|TPMT *1/*2, *1/*3A, or *1/*3C| n=15 |
|TPMT homozygote| n=1 |

The single individual in the study who was *homozygous* for a TPMT variant (unspecified) and was in the standard dosing arm experienced severe nonfatal neutropenia.

publication.title: A pragmatic randomized controlled trial of thiopurine methyltransferase genotyping prior to azathioprine treatment: the TARGET study.
